channel.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
channel.description: Ok... So last night I torrented the i384 version of Linux Kubuntu 7.04 and used MagicISO to burn it to a CD. Today, when I tried to boot from the CD it didn't work. I made sure that everything was plugged in and my mobo recognized my 2 hard drives and my disk drive. I'm trying to install Kukuntu a 40GB drive) that is my Secondary Master drive. When I boot, I press Escape and boot from the CD, then I get a black screen for about 2 minutes and then the option to boot from XP or Vista (From my other HD). Any clues why it won't install?

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Moparisthebest:

So it is a problem with the computer you are trying to boot it on, I have had certain cdrom drives that simply refuse to boot from cds.

Nope, it was my hard drive for some reason, I swapped it with a 40gb Samsung drive that I stole from an old computer and guess what!? KUBUNTU! I’m installing it now, thanks for the help mopar + MybBob.

EDIT: Now for my next project, getting a *ubuntu to boot from a 2G flash drive…

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So it is a problem with the computer you are trying to boot it on, I have had certain cdrom drives that simply refuse to boot from cds.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Moparisthebest:

i386 will work on all PCs from around 93ish to now, even on 64-bit, so you got the right version, you either burned the cd wrong, or your computer is having some other problems booting from a cd.

Well, I booted up from my other pc and it worked fine, I checked the integrety (sp?) of the disc and it came out with no errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

i386 will work on all PCs from around 93ish to now, even on 64-bit, so you got the right version, you either burned the cd wrong, or your computer is having some other problems booting from a cd.

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“MybBob, post:4, topic:84305”]Hmmm, let me get you Xubuntu download links, ( The ones I used )

Maybe it will boot, then you can install your chosen *Buntu from it

http://cdimages.ubuntu.com/xubuntu/releases/feisty/release/[/quote]

So many downloads! Lol, good thing I have 2 TBs of hard drive space. I think it could also be a compatablity issue, I may have downloaded the wrong version (x64 or x86)

I'll assume you meant the i386 version, and try burning it again, it probably burned wrong or was a bad cd.

I did, I tried 3 different CDs. and I’m only 2 numbers off xD

EDIT: I’m going to try the CD in my other computer and see what happens. Be back in 10 minutes!

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I torrented the Live CD version of it and burned it to a CD (obviously) and I put it in my computer with Windows on it and it gave me the Kubuntu message screen saying to test out FireFox, insert into a computer and boot with it, etc. but now when I try to use it with a computer with no operating system it won’t boot.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu 7.04 help
item.dc:creator: @MybBob MybBob
item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

Sorry, but that seems abit strange to me, when I booted into Xubuntu I just went to the boot screen, chose the dvd / cd and then booted, you SHOULD get a black screen for a few seconds ish, and then it will go to another " menu " screen, from there you have the choice to start / install it start in safe graphics modes and such.

Another option would be for you to download Ubuntu and do the apt-get install Kubuntu thing, but yes, sorry I cant enlighten you more

Read full topic
